body:
@tamis-laan Can you access the bucket using boto3?

Example: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32618216/override-s3-endpoint-using-boto3-configuration-file

@tamis-laan Can you run this code?

```python
# Save this code as a.py

import os
import mlflow

assert "MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL" in os.environ
assert "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" in os.environ
assert "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" in os.environ


with mlflow.start_run():
    mlflow.log_artifact(__file__)
```

Did you set `MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL` when running your client code?
@harupy I need to finish some work and then I will get back to this issue.

> assert "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" in os.environ
> 
> 
> with mlflow.start_run():
>     mlflow.log_artifact(__file__)
> ```
> 
> Did you set `MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL` when running your client code?

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/httpsession.py", line 484, in send

botocore.exceptions.EndpointConnectionError: Could not connect to the endpoint URL: "https://s3.nl-ams.amazonaws.com/mlflow/0/fdd9829327504b1594347025d7807cdd/artifacts/test.py"

@tamis-laan Got it, can you access the bucket with boto3?

Example: https://stackoverflow.com/a/41327767

Using boto3 I can connect to the object storage:

```
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://0.0.0.0:8000
MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI=postgresql://<user>:<pass>@<ip>:<port>/mlflow
MLFLOW_ARTIFACTS_DESTINATION=s3://mflow
MLFLOW_DEFAULT_ARTIFACT_ROOT=https://models.xxx.xxx.xxx.cloud/
MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL=https://models.xxx.xxx.xxxx.cloud/
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=xxxxxxxxxxxx
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=xxxxxxxxxxxx
```

``` python
import boto3
import os

session = boto3.session.Session()

s3_client = session.client(
    service_name='s3',
    aws_access_key_id=os.getenv('AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID'),
    aws_secret_access_key=os.getenv('AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'),
    endpoint_url=os.getenv('MLFLOW_DEFAULT_ARTIFACT_ROOT'),
    region_name=os.getenv('AWS_DEFAULT_REGION')
)

print(s3_client.list_buckets())
```

But running the server results in:
```
 2022/10/24 19:56:51 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/artifacts/list [GET]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2525, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1822, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1820, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1796, in dispatch_request
    return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**view_args)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 455, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 525, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 914, in _list_artifacts
    artifact_entities = _get_artifact_repo(run).list_artifacts(path)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/s3_artifact_repo.py", line 159, in list_artifacts
    for result in results:
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/paginate.py", line 269, in __iter__
    response = self._make_request(current_kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/paginate.py", line 357, in _make_request
    return self._method(**current_kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 514, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-server-jL1b2NAi/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 938, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.errorfactory.NoSuchKey: An error occurred (NoSuchKey) when calling the ListObjectsV2 operation: The specified key does not exist.
```
@tamis-laan The traceback says "the specified key does not exist". Are you sure the artifact URI is correct?

Don't know if this could help, I've had a similar issue with remote tracking (with mlflow==1.29.0 and mlflow==1.30.0) of artifacts on Digital Ocean Spaces compatible S3 and **resolved** with this [harupy comment](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/7104#issuecomment-1288522699), before I wasn't setting MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL=`https://<region-name>.digitaloceanspaces.com` (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/5439) also on the client side (only S3 credentials) and I was getting an error like:

`Could not connect to the endpoint URL: "https://<bucket-name>.s3.<region-name>.amazonaws.com/5/190cbf0a10734f308d070059f0dd8698/artifacts/model/model.pkl"`

from a `mlflow.sklearn.log_model` on a simple jupyter lab on the mlflow _sklearn_logistic_regression_ example,
so there was clearly a malformed url instead of the correct one `https://<bucket-name>.<region-name>.digitaloceanspaces.com`.

IMHO this issue clashes with the [official documentation](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#amazon-s3-and-s3-compatible-storage) when a a **warning box** says:

> ... For example, providing --default-artifact-root $MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL on the server side **and** MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL on the client side will create a **client path resolution issue for the artifact storage location** ... 

continuing with

> ... To prevent path parsing issues, **ensure** that reserved environment variables are **removed (unset)** from client environments. 

Actually **the opposite is true**, so now if this is the intended way to make S3 compatbile storage working for remote artifact storage maybe the official documentation has to be (temporarily? if this is a bug) updated.

Oke let me give some clarity on my setup and what is happening. I'm trying to setup a tracking server and log experiments and artifacts over there. This way I can also use mlflow as my model store.

I configure the mlflow server using environment variables as followed:
```
MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI=xxx://xxx:xxx@xxx:xxx/mlflow

AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=xxxx
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=xxxx
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=xxx
MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL=https://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.cloud

MLFLOW_DEFAULT_ARTIFACT_ROOT=s3://mlflow/
MLFLOW_ARTIFACTS_DESTINATION=s3://mlflow/
```

I start the ml server as followed:
```
mlflow server --serve-artifacts -h 0.0.0.0 -p 8000
```

Next I run @harupy his clinet side code to create and log an artifact:
``` python
# Save this code as a.py

import os
import mlflow

with mlflow.start_run():
    mlflow.log_artifact(__file__)
```

I'm using the following client side environment variables:
```
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://0.0.0.0:8000
```

This results in the following client side error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/$HOME/dev/ai-mlflow-client/client.py", line 7, in <module>
    mlflow.log_artifact(__file__)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 777, in log_artifact
    MlflowClient().log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 1136, in log_artifact
    self._tracking_client.log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 460, in log_artifact
    artifact_repo.log_artifact(local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/s3_artifact_repo.py", line 125, in log_artifact
    self._upload_file(
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/s3_artifact_repo.py", line 118, in _upload_file

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/boto3/s3/inject.py", line 143, in upload_file
    return transfer.upload_file(
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/boto3/s3/transfer.py", line 288, in upload_file
    future.result()
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/s3transfer/futures.py", line 103, in result
    return self._coordinator.result()
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/s3transfer/futures.py", line 266, in result
    raise self._exception
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/s3transfer/tasks.py", line 139, in __call__

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/s3transfer/tasks.py", line 162, in _execute_main

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/s3transfer/upload.py", line 758, in _main
    client.put_object(Bucket=bucket, Key=key, Body=body, **extra_args)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 514, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 921, in _make_api_call
    http, parsed_response = self._make_request(
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 944, in _make_request

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/endpoint.py", line 119, in make_request

    request = self.create_request(request_dict, operation_model)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/endpoint.py", line 134, in create_request
    self._event_emitter.emit(
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/hooks.py", line 412, in emit

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/hooks.py", line 256, in emit

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/hooks.py", line 239, in _emit
    response = handler(**kwargs)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/signers.py", line 105, in handler

  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/signers.py", line 189, in sign
    auth.add_auth(request)
  File "/$HOME/.local/share/virtualenvs/ai-mlflow-client-Dw4aBqq7/lib/python3.10/site-packages/botocore/auth.py", line 418, in add_auth
    raise NoCredentialsError()
botocore.exceptions.NoCredentialsError: Unable to locate credentials
```
I'm not sure what `botocore` is doing on the client side as the client should only communicate with the mlflow server.

@tamis-laan 

```python
import mlflow

mlflow.MlflowClient().list_artifacts(<run_id>)
```

Can you list artifacts using this code?
